title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

Adopted by Augustus as his heir and successor apparent and given an inside track for political advancement, Marcellus died prematurely at the age of 19 in 23 B.C., his death being universally lamented. Octavia is said to have swooned with grief at Vergil's reading of this passage and later to have rewarded the poet for his tribute.

A 3-point answer must contain the following elements, expressed in one or more sentences: The name Marcellus must be given; the relationship to Augustus must be stated; Marcellus' premature death must be mentioned.

A 2-point answer must contain at least two of the above items expressed in one or more sentences.

A 1-point answer must contain one of the above items.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

Adopted by Augustus as his heir and successor apparent and given an inside track for political advancement, Marcellus died prematurely at the age of 19 in 23 B.C., his death being universally lamented. Octavia is said to have swooned with grief at Vergil's reading of this passage and later to have rewarded the poet for his tribute.

A 3-point answer must contain the following elements, expressed in one or more sentences: The name Marcellus must be given; the relationship to Augustus must be stated; Marcellus' premature death must be mentioned.

A 2-point answer must contain at least two of the above items expressed in one or more sentences.

A 1-point answer must contain one of the above items.

Student response earns one of the available points.

A 3-point answer must contain the following elements, expressed in one or more sentences: The name Marcellus must be given; the relationship to Augustus must be stated; Marcellus' premature death must be mentioned.

A 2-point answer must contain at least two of the above items expressed in one or more sentences.

A 1-point answer must contain one of the above items.

Student response earns two of the available points.

Octavia is said to have swooned with grief at Vergil's reading of this passage and later to have rewarded the poet for his tribute.

A 3-point answer must contain the following elements, expressed in one or more sentences: The name Marcellus must be given; the relationship to Augustus must be stated; Marcellus' premature death must be mentioned.

A 2-point answer must contain at least two of the above items expressed in one or more sentences.

A 1-point answer must contain one of the above items.

Student response earns three of the available points.

Adopted by Augustus as his heir and successor apparent and given an inside track for political advancement, Marcellus died prematurely at the age of 19 in 23 B.C., his death being universally lamented. Octavia is said to have swooned with grief at Vergil's reading of this passage and later to have rewarded the poet for his tribute.

A 3-point answer must contain the following elements, expressed in one or more sentences: The name Marcellus must be given; the relationship to Augustus must be stated; Marcellus' premature death must be mentioned.

A 1-point answer must contain one of the above items.

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
7 points maximum

Translation (4 points)

egregium forma iuvenem et fulgentibus armis "a young man outstanding in appearance and gleaming armor"

A total of 4 points is possible, one point per the following:

A iuvenis is a young person, generally between the ages of 20 and 40. Accept "young man," "young person", or "youth." Readers accepted, but very reluctantly, "juvenile" or "boy."

egregium. Readers accepted "extraordinary, distinguished, surpassing, excellent, eminent, outstanding, select, marvellous, exceptional, singular, illustrious," and the like, but did not accept "egregious."

The ablatives could be translated variously as "in, with, by, in respect to, because of, as to."

For forma, readers accepted "appearance, looks, figure, shape, feature(s)" or "beauty, form."

For armis, readers accepted "armor, arms, weapons, implements of war." For fulgentibus, readers accepted "shining, bright, gleaming, flashing, dazzling, glistening, illustrious, glorious."

Identification and Description (3 points)

1 point for identification

2 points for sentences of description
